page.title: 01Oving village & farm land
page.content: Oving village, population currently about 450 dominates the block. Together with Pitchcott hamlet to the south west and the outskirts of the larger village of Whitchurch it sits on a ridge approximately 550ft (180m) above sea level. Once peopled largely by local artesans, farm workers and lace markers, most inhabitants now commute out of the village to work. Little building took place between the 1939/45 war and the early 1980's, when the arrival of mains drainage brought a spate of new houses. There is little organised social life within the village & most people travel to the larger villages & towns for entertain- ment. Bus services are infrequent so cars are essential. The church & chapel congregations are small. Funds are constantly required for the repairs to the parish church and
